summary:
## SS Edmund Fitzgerald: A Great Lakes Tragedy

The SS Edmund Fitzgerald was a huge cargo ship that sank in Lake Superior in 1975. All 29 crew members died. It was the largest ship to ever sink on the Great Lakes. The cause is still unknown, but a storm with huge waves likely played a role.

The sinking made people aware of the dangers of Great Lakes shipping. New rules were made to keep sailors safer. A famous song by Gordon Lightfoot also helped remember this tragic event.
title: SS Edmund Fitzgerald
